properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:52AM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations
of 5 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Western Siskiyou County above 3500 feet, including
Etna Summit on Sawyers Bar road and Grayback road.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 4 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Hazardous conditions
could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down
tree branches.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
